item.title: Terri add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Every time a child says 'I don't believe in fairies' there is a little fairy somewhere that falls down dead." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Terri add a quote by John Maeda
item.description: "The problem isn't how to make the world more technological. It's about how to make the world more humane again." -- John Maeda

item.title: Terri add a quote by Aurelius Augustinus
item.description: "Pray as though everything depends on God. And work as if everything depends on you." -- Aurelius Augustinus

item.title: Terri add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Terri add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Writing a novel is a terrible experience, during which the hair often falls out and the teeth decay. " -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Terri add a quote by Emmy Swain
item.description: "It's all about the smiles!" -- Emmy Swain

item.title: Terri add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Terri add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Terri add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Terri add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Terri add a quote by August Strindberg
item.description: "Life is not so idiotically mathematical that only the big eat the small; it is just as common for a bee to kill a lion or at least to drive it mad." -- August Strindberg

item.title: Terri add a quote by Walter Mosley
item.description: "A peasant that reads is a prince in waiting." -- Walter Mosley

item.title: Terri add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "It was one of those humid days when the atmosphere gets confused. Sitting on the porch, you could feel it: the air wishing it was water." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Terri add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Terri add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Terri add a quote by William Strunk Jr.
item.description: "Omit needless words." -- William Strunk Jr.

item.title: Terri add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Terri add a quote by Sarah Addison Allen
item.description: "But relying on one person for your every need is so dangerous. One set of hands isn't enough to keep you from falling." -- Sarah Addison Allen

item.title: Terri add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Terri add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Terri add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It is a great thing to start life with a small number of really good books which are your very own." -- Arthur Conan Doyle
